txt.en: 'What have you done?! Die, traitors!'
'Be silent, fool! We cannot return home, if the refugees are to be believed, so we must fight!'
Tuhâl is nervously waiting to speak to the Jangovar leaders.\n\nYou should talk to Tuhâl.
'Ah, our Chayasir recruits! I have been hearing good things about you two. How quickly you climb the ranks.'
'If only the other Chayasír and Dorwinion were so willing, these lands would have already been conquered.  A shame you were not born Jangovar, eh? Come, join us at our table.'
'We shall find a new source of weapons, then. A shame this backwater village does not have the resources we need to make our own.'
'Hah! No one underestimates Náin the Slakeless and lives. Come, it is time to leave this village.'
TBD
'The dwarves and Dale-folk will never accept us unless we conquer them! There will be no forgiveness for siding with the Dark Lord. We will always be seen as foreign monsters to them!'
'Follow me. My guards will clear our way.'
'Here we are, [placeholder]. Let us not reveal ourselves now that we are so close to our goal! Just behave as a Jangovar would, and keep your head down.'
'Look at him, white as a sheet! There you have it. Our only choice is to conquer these lands, as we were ordered to. We must find a new source of weapons.'
'Oh ho, so it seems fate has delivered us a new source of weapons in our time of need! We will plan an ambush along their path and-'
Instance: The Lone Dwarf
'The weapons from Hammerstead are well-made. The ambush on the convoy was a great boon, but we do not yet have enough arms or men to take Dale.'
'A lone dwarf has come? Interesting. Show him inside.'
'Brave of you to come here alone, dwarf. What do you want?'
'We do not even know what occured in Rhûn after we departed for war, Akh. All we have are a few rumours from the other clans! What say you, Chayasír? Are the rumours true?'
'Oh ho, so the dwarves are finally giving up! I would meet with your leader-'
'We are with you, Lord Náin!'
'I have come to negotiate the terms of surrender.'
'You misunderstand, Easterling.'
'Wait, your face... Náin the Slakeless?! What do you mean to accomplish here? You are wholly outnumbered, fool!'
'My scouts have reported that the Zhélruka Dwarves are passing through, heading west. The scouts noted that they appeared heavily armed.'
Náin has attacked the Jangovar!
The Jangovar leaders are defeated!
'I meant YOUR surrender.'
You have escaped the chaos in Utterby
'Am I? Baruk Khazâd! Khazâd ai-mênu!'
The Jangovar are conversing.\n\nYou should listen to the conversation.
Listen to the conversation
Defeat the Jangovar
Escape Er Shamol
Talk to Tuhâl
TBD
'...Yes, they are.'
'Hammerstead rebuffed our assault. They will be expecting us now. I do not think another ambush will be successful.'
'Come, we have much to discuss.'
'I mean no offence, Akh, but we may be out of options. The dwarf-settlements are well-defended, and we cannot return to raid the Dale-lands with such small forces. Perhaps it is time to-'
'Get away from that, thief!'
You have secured an audience with the Jangovar leaders, but time runs short. Lord Náin's attack comes soon.
Escape Utterby with Náin and Tuhâl
Talk to Náin
Náin the Slakeless has engaged the Jangovar in battle!\n\nYou should defeat the Jangovar!
The dwarves have attacked Utterby!\n\nYou should follow Náin and escape!

Náin cracks his neck and stretches his arms.

'Hah! Those foolhardy Easterlings were no match for Narag-felak, the Blackhewer!'

He gently pats his mattock.

'Your prowess in battle impresses me, [placeholder]. Now that the Jangovar leaders are dealt with, we have much to discuss.'
Náin would like to speak with you.\n\nYou should talk to Náin.
'Akh, a dwarf has come to the village! He says he must speak with you!'
